column4: `edit etc/fstab` doesn't work, it says that I have no permission.
How do I edit it ?
gksudo gedit /etc/fstab
gedit filename ,will run gedit and open the file
the problem is that this command you've specified opens gedit in terminal, which means untill I close gedit I can't do anything else in terminal..
then suffix with an ampersand
gedit filename &
thanks.
if you aren't the owner you can run: gksudo gedit filename & ,to run gedit with elevated access
what plugin do they use? flash? java?
I think java, when I played it on windows, I had to install java.
sudo -i
log off and log in to gnome classic
yes, you will need to resize your NTFS and install to the free space
I'd use:  dpkg -l  | grep  part        change part for some of the name of the app you installed
I don't can't find this package I've installed, however if I search it it shows that it exists.
you will then have the name of the package, you can then use:  sudo apt-get --purge remove name
what is the name of the deb you installed?
try:   dpkg -l | grep charm
I tried this, but I didn't find that package..
if you run:  history | grep dpkg     does it give a deb name?
no. Perhaps it wasn't a .deb package..
then try:  history | grep apt-get
gedit &
